definition: to spread out after being diluted or melted/to dissolve into a liquid
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: The colours of your shirt ran when I washed it.
sentences.chinese: 我一洗，你衬衫上的颜色就化开了。

sentences.english: Hold me close; melt my heart like April snow.
sentences.chinese: 抱紧我，将我的心如四月融雪般化开。

sentences.english: Simply melt butter before adding flour to form a roux over medium heat.
sentences.chinese: 将黄油化开，加入面粉，中火调成面糊。

sentences.english: Melt butter in a heavy pan. Sautee onion at medium heat until soft.
sentences.chinese: 厚底锅，奶油化开，用中火把洋葱炒软。

sentences.english: If love could not resist this scourge, but faith can be sad to open.
sentences.chinese: 就算用爱抵挡不了这天灾，但信念可将悲伤都化开。

sentences.english: Completely dissolve the remaining lard in the hot water.
sentences.chinese: 用热水将剩余猪油完全化开。

sentences.english: Use the hair dryer to melt a hard candy.
sentences.chinese: 用吹风筒把一颗水果糖吹化开。

sentences.english: She thawed out the frozen meat in the microwave oven.
sentences.chinese: 她用微波炉将冻肉化开。

sentences.english: The woman's eyelids were closed and her mascara was melting.
sentences.chinese: 女人闭上了眼睛，睫毛油化开了。

sentences.english: She freezes them instantly, then watches them revive as they thaw in the water.
sentences.chinese: 把青蛙瞬间冻住，然后扔到水里看着冻青蛙化开。

definition: to melt/to thaw/to dissolve/to blend into/to combine/to fuse
to freeze/to solidify/to congeal/fig. with rapt attention
